content: Cu-MOF was synthesized on the basis of the literature. A 5 mg sample of Cu­(NO3)2·3H2O and 20 mg of PVP were added to a flask and dissolved in a mixture of 12 mL of DMF and 4 mL of anhydrous ethanol; then 12 mg of TCPP was added and the mixture was sonicated for 10 min. The resulting solution was transferred to a stainless steel autoclave and reacted at 80 °C for 3 h. As it cooled to room temperature, the precipitate was collected by centrifugation, and the solid was washed three times with ethanol and then freeze-dried to obtain Cu-MOF nanosheets. Cu-MOF@MnO2 was prepared by the reference method. A 20 mg sample of the prepared Cu-MOF nanosheets was dispersed into 20 mL of water and sonicated for 10 min. Then 20 mg of PAH (dissolved in 10 mL of water and adjusted to pH 7.2 with saturated sodium bicarbonate solution) was added and stirred at room temperature overnight. Then the precipitate was collected by centrifugation for 15 min (at 8000 rpm/min) and washed with water three times to remove the excess PAH to obtain Cu-MOF-PAH. Then Cu-MOF-PAH was redispersed in 30 mL of water and sonicated for 10 min, and KMnO4 (10 mg dissolved in 2 mL of water) was added dropwise under vigorous stirring. After 30 min of stirring, the precipitate was adjusted to weak acidity (pH 6.8) with 2 M HCl, centrifuged for 20 min (speed 8000 rpm/min), washed three times with water, and freeze-dried to obtain Cu-MOF@MnO2. A 30 mg sample of Cu-MOF@MnO2 nanoparticles was dispersed in 30 mL of DMF and sonicated for 10 min. A 96 mg sample of EDC and 58 mg of NHS were added and stirred at room temperature for 3 h. Then 20 mg of 1,6-hexanediamine was added and reacted for 6 h. The precipitated Cu-MOF@MnO2-NH2 was extracted by centrifugation for 20 min (at 8000 rpm/min), washed three times with water, and dispersed in 10 mL of DMF. Then 30 mg of FA and 20 mg of TPP were dissolved in 30 mL of DMF, respectively, followed by the addition of EDC/NHS (144 mg/88 mg) at room temperature. After stirring for 12 h, the activated FA and activated TPP were obtained, respectively. The Cu-MOF@MnO2-NH2 was then added to the solutions with activated FA or activated TPP to obtain Cu-MOF@MnO2/FA and Cu-MOF@MnO2/TPP.
clean_text:
Materials and Methods

Sample Preparation and Characterization

Cu-MOF was synthesized on the basis of the literature. A 5 mg sample of Cu(NO3)2⋅3H2O and 20 mg of PVP were added to a flask and dissolved in a mixture of 12 mL of DMF and 4 mL of anhydrous ethanol; then 12 mg of TCPP was added and the mixture was sonicated for 10 min. The resulting solution was transferred to a stainless steel autoclave and reacted at 80 °C for 3 h. As it cooled to room temperature, the precipitate was collected by centrifugation, and the solid was washed three times with ethanol and then freeze-dried to obtain Cu-MOF nanosheets. Cu-MOF@MnO2 was prepared by the reference method. A 20 mg sample of the prepared Cu-MOF nanosheets was dispersed into 20 mL of water and sonicated for 10 min. Then 20 mg of PAH (dissolved in 10 mL of water and adjusted to pH 7.2 with saturated sodium bicarbonate solution) was added and stirred at room temperature overnight. Then the precipitate was collected by centrifugation for 15 min (at 8000 rpm/min) and washed with water three times to remove the excess PAH to obtain Cu-MOF-PAH. Then Cu-MOF-PAH was redispersed in 30 mL of water and sonicated for 10 min, and KMnO4 (10 mg dissolved in 2 mL of water) was added dropwise under vigorous stirring. After 30 min of stirring, the precipitate was adjusted to weak acidity (pH 6.8) with 2 M HCl, centrifuged for 20 min (speed 8000 rpm/min), washed three times with water, and freeze-dried to obtain Cu-MOF@MnO2. A 30 mg sample of Cu-MOF@MnO2 nanoparticles was dispersed in 30 mL of DMF and sonicated for 10 min. A 96 mg sample of EDC and 58 mg of NHS were added and stirred at room temperature for 3 h. Then 20 mg of 1,6-hexanediamine was added and reacted for 6 h. The precipitated Cu-MOF@MnO2-NH2 was extracted by centrifugation for 20 min (at 8000 rpm/min), washed three times with water, and dispersed in 10 mL of DMF. Then 30 mg of FA and 20 mg of TPP were dissolved in 30 mL of DMF, respectively, followed by the addition of EDC/NHS (144 mg/88 mg) at room temperature. After stirring for 12 h, the activated FA and activated TPP were obtained, respectively. The Cu-MOF@MnO2-NH2 was then added to the solutions with activated FA or activated TPP to obtain Cu-MOF@MnO2/FA and Cu-MOF@MnO2/TPP.
